p: According to Arumugam and his group method (Arumugam et al., 2019), Trypsin fersin was added to HCAM cells by trypsinization process and then added medium RPMI-1640, put a clean and sterilized slide on the planted cells dish and start planted 5,000 of HCAM cells on the slide cover and then covered tightly it by parafilm sheet for 24 h in the incubator 5% CO 2 and 37 ºC. After 24 h, discard the medium and added IC 50 value of MF, then close the dish tightly and re-incubate for 24 h, next, raised up the slide cover and put it in a clean slide and added 70 µl of AO/EB stain, and immediately take the slide under Fluorescent microscope (Flourecent Microscope, Zeiss axiolabe, CE, Germany) to record the photos.
